channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pave by and roadside outside malorees infant and junior school, 25th October
item.description:
Huge amount of leaves debris piling up making impossible to manoeuvre pram or wheelchair, very slippery underfoot - children falling - also blocking drains - 3weeks present getting continually worse

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeping Willow tree, 25th October
item.description:
Why have you cut down the beautiful weeping willow tree ? Why have you left the area devastated- not even clearing away the debris No new trees have been planted in the park for over three years yet you have felled many established trees. Hardly any stump grinding has been undertaken - just ugly stumps left everywhere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Across Grayland Court at the entrance of Heathcote Street, 25th October
item.description:
This bench has been recently added to Heathcote Street and has since caused increased disruption to the area where we have noticed anti social and obnoxious behaviour including vomiting (as shown in the provided picture), garbage, and loud music and yelling throughout the day. Could we please have this bench removed, as this has been increasingly distressing. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1b, Heathcote Street, King's Cross, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial waste in private household bin, 25th October
item.description:
Not fixed as updated by the council at 6.20am, as picture taken at 1.00pm. Commercial business (K&K Groceries) still proceeding to fly tip boxes and rubbish from a commercial property into private household waste bin. If the general public can be fined how can commercial businesses not be? There is even less space for household waste as the bins have still and continue to be used by the business.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 289,291, Walworth Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
